you could try parsing the inputted String for the said operators and then getting the integers on the left or right.

what was that method… charAt()? sorry, i’m not too sure.

Can you give me an example please, because I don’t udnerstand some words you said, like parsing and integers…
[/quote]

Parsing means to basically analyze something, and integers are ints.[/quote]
Thanks mate

item.title: First program ever, help required please
item.dc:creator: @wartek wartek
item.description:
@wartek wrote:

Alright guys, I have made a very noobish calculator with java eveything works fine but I don’t like one thing .
Everytime when I need to assign an amount to a variable I need to enter, instead of that I want to space.
This is how it is:

2n0359u.png744×127

This is how I want it:
2m46kk3.png743×120

Here is the code

[code]import java.util.Scanner;
import static java.lang.System.out;

public class Calc {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	Scanner Calc = new Scanner (System.in);
	Scanner myScanner = new Scanner (System.in);
	double term1 = 0,term2 = 0;
	char symbol;
	
	out.println("Write your formule here,Use only '+' '-' '*' and '/' please.");
	
	term1 = Calc.nextDouble();
	symbol = myScanner.findInLine(".").charAt(0);
	term2 = Calc.nextDouble();
	
	if(symbol == '+'){
			out.print(term1 + term2);
	}else if(symbol == '-'){
			out.print(term1 - term2);
	}else if(symbol == '*'){
			out.print(term1 * term2);
	}else if(symbol == '/'){
			out.print(term1 / term2);
	}
	else{
			out.print("Please use '+' '-' '*' or '/'.");
	}

}

}[/code]
And also if there is something I could change to make the code look better just say it, feedback is welcome, but if you want to troll me just click on the red cross in the upper right corner of your screen ._.
-Wartek

Read full topic
